io.nats.client

Class ConnectionFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.nats.client.ConnectionFactory

  • public class ConnectionFactory
extends Object
    A ConnectionFactory object encapsulates a set of connection configuration options. A client uses it to create a connection to NATS.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConnectionFactory()
      Constructs a connection factory using default parameters.
      ConnectionFactory(ConnectionFactory cf)
      Constructs a ConnectionFactory by copying the supplied ConnectionFactory.
      ConnectionFactory(Properties props)
      Constructs a new connection factory from a Properties object.
      ConnectionFactory(String url)
      Constructs a connection factory using the supplied URL string as default.
      ConnectionFactory(String[] servers)
      Constructs a connection factory from a list of NATS server URL strings.
      ConnectionFactory(String url, String[] servers)
      Constructs a connection factory from a list of NATS server URLs, using url as the primary address.

        public ConnectionFactory(String url)

        url - the default server URL to use

      • ConnectionFactory

        public ConnectionFactory(String[] servers)
        Constructs a connection factory from a list of NATS server URL strings.
        Parameters:
        servers - the list of cluster server URL strings

      • ConnectionFactory

        public ConnectionFactory(String url,
                         String[] servers)
        Constructs a connection factory from a list of NATS server URLs, using url as the primary address.

        If url contains a single server address, that address will be first in the server list, even if isNoRandomize() is false.

        If url is a comma-delimited list of servers, then servers will be ignored.

        Parameters:
        url - the default server URL to set
        servers - the list of cluster server URL strings

      • ConnectionFactory

        public ConnectionFactory(ConnectionFactory cf)
        Constructs a ConnectionFactory by copying the supplied ConnectionFactory.
        Parameters:
        cf - the ConnectionFactory to copy

      • isNoRandomize

        public final boolean isNoRandomize()
        Indicates whether server list randomization is disabled.

        true means that the server list will be traversed in the order in which it was received

        false means that the server list will be randomized before it is traversed

        Returns:
        true if server list randomization is disabled, otherwise false

      • setNoRandomize

        public final void setNoRandomize(boolean noRandomize)
        Disables or enables server list randomization.
        Parameters:
        noRandomize - the noRandomize to set

        Parameters:

      • isVerbose

        public final boolean isVerbose()
        Indicates whether verbose is set.

        When verbose==true, the server will acknowledge each protocol line with +OK or -ERR

        Returns:
        whether verbose is set

      • setVerbose

        public final void setVerbose(boolean verbose)
        Sets whether verbose is set.
        Parameters:
        verbose - whether or not this connection should require protocol acks from the server (+OK/-ERR)

      • isPedantic

        public final boolean isPedantic()
        Indicates whether strict server-side protocol checking is enabled.
        Returns:
        whether pedantic is set

      • setPedantic

        public final void setPedantic(boolean pedantic)
        Sets whether strict server-side protocol checking is enabled.

        When pedantic==true , strict server-side protocol checking occurs.

        Parameters:
        pedantic - whether or not this connection should require strict server-side protocol checking

        public final long getReconnectWait()

        the reconnect wait interval in milliseconds

        public final void setReconnectBufSize(int size)

        Parameters:
        size - the reconnect buffer size, in bytes

      • getConnectionTimeout

        public final int getConnectionTimeout()
        Returns the connection timeout interval in milliseconds. This is the maximum amount of time to wait for a connection to a NATS server to complete successfully
        Returns:
        the connection timeout

      • setConnectionTimeout

        public final void setConnectionTimeout(int timeout)
        Sets the connection timeout interval in milliseconds. This is the maximum amount of time to wait for a connection to a NATS server to complete successfully
        Parameters:
        timeout - the connection timeout
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if timeout < 0

      • getPingInterval

        public final long getPingInterval()
        Gets the server ping interval in milliseconds. The connection will send a PING to the server at this interval to ensure the server is still alive
        Returns:
        the pingInterval

      • setPingInterval

        public final void setPingInterval(long interval)
        Sets the server ping interval in milliseconds. The connection will send a PING to the server at this interval to ensure the server is still alive
        Parameters:
        interval - the ping interval to set in milliseconds

      • getMaxPingsOut

        public final int getMaxPingsOut()
        Returns the maximum number of outstanding server pings
        Returns:
        the maximum number of oustanding outbound pings before marking the Connection stale and triggering reconnection (if allowed).

      • setMaxPingsOut

        public final void setMaxPingsOut(int max)
        Sets the maximum number of outstanding pings (pings for which no pong has been received). Once this limit is exceeded, the connection is marked as stale and closed.
        Parameters:
        max - the maximum number of outstanding pings
